newsitem.title: USA: Louisiana regulators back 2 Cajun proposals.
newsitem.headline: Louisiana regulators back 2 Cajun proposals.

text.p: The Louisiana Public Service Commission found the rate plans in two proposals in the Cajun Electric Power Cooperative Inc bankruptcy to be "not presumptively unreasonable," Southwestern Electric Power said.

However, the Central & South West Corp subsidiary said, the commission's order found the rate path in the plan proposed by the court appointed trustee is too high. The trustee is backing an offer from Northern States Power Co, Southern Co and Zeigler Coal Holding Co.
The plans supported were put forward by Southwestern and Entergy Corp, and by Enron Corp.
"We're pleased that the Louisana Public Service Commission sees our rate path as viable," said Southwestern spokesman Peter Main.

"The commission encouraged the proponents of the three reorganization plans now before the court to improve their plans for the ratepayers and we will do that," he continued without providing any specifics.

The utility said the commission's action was part of a docket to review the competing reorganization plans for Cajun. The order was adopted unanimously and will be forwarded to the bankruptcy court along with a report from the commission's general counsel.
The court began hearings on the plans Monday and is expected to issue a decision next month.
